intro: Bartsia strigosa, commonly known as the hairy bartsia, is a flowering plant native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its parasitic nature. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and forest floors. Its small, white or pale pink flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Bartsia strigosa is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name.
